comment: Light but peaty. Good for price
A great, affordable malt to introduce one to Islay.
Strong 'vodka' taste. Strong peat taste. Very salty. Leaves nice aftertaste, similar to Ardbeg 18
Has a good flavor profile with a hint of smoke but overall it feels watered down and weak
My standing grad school desk scotch
Very good for cheaper price tag
Good for the price.  Watery at first then pepper and spice. Not complex.
Light in flavor. Prefer the 10 year
Peaty, but not very. Goes down smooth at the front of the tongue, but burns slightly in the back.  Generally easy I drink but not very interesting.
I do not like scotch or peat r smoke
Interessanter Geschmack, nicht soooo vielfältig, aber gut.
earthy peat, undertones of orchard fruit, dark cocoa, vanilla and marzipan. Creamy texture cut by light alcohol, pineapple notes, honey and peat. Lightly complex finish.
Slightly mismatched flavors, but really good for the price. Definitely a sleepy time drink, and something good to wind down with.

Actually Bowmore Darkest sherry casked
$70 @ PPC on on 03/31/2009
Nose: Mild peat with green apple crispness; woody. Creamy on the palate with butterscotch candy sweetness fading to a briny and surprisingly long finish.
Licht, citrus, licht rokerig, lekker om flink door te borrelen
Expected salt and peat (much less than say caol ila 12) with caramel then med-long peppery finish

I personally loved it. A lot of taste and character but as with all whisky every bottle is a surprise. It goes well with my cigars I buy (as long as you don't go something too over powering.) It was a decent price when I bought it . I loved it. It's something I use on the regular when I want to really relax or have a good cigar. Will not disappoint.
Decent entrance to the peat whisky world. Affordable, easy drinking.

Very little is left to the imagination with this dram. Smoke. Lemon. Honey. That's it. While not a stunner, it's one I'll happily drink out of a rocks glass when I'm eating greasy food. I expect nothing more of this, which is probably for the best.
tasted at caputo's, not enough punch for me.  Saltiness. Wouldn't seek it out.
A typical Islay style whiskey. Not too peaty but with some medical notes on the nose. Oily texture, toffee and vanilla but not too fruity or complex. Balanced smoke in the finish. A good sip!
A fantastic dram for the price. Subtle peat and oak at play with a nice floral and dried fruit finish some ocean but everything is incredibly balanced.

Do I like it? Yes I do.  When the quality of the whiskey is higher than the price, I love it. A great way for someone who wants to try a single malt without playing a lot, this is a great choice.  Love the peat and fruit balance.
This got me onto Bowmore and it's cheap so a decent gateway Bowmore and then once you're hooked you can move on up the range and smile.

this is 40% entry level scotch. nice and well balanced 
note: sea smoke, lemon, caramel
palate: soft and mild, sweet, seawater, wood fire
finish: med long, peat, charcoal
Voni prijemne decentne, ovsem chutna uplne jinak. Na zacatku jako mokry korek, pozdeji uz lepe, trochu peaty, trochu morsky, celkove ale nic moc.
Légèrement fumé, petit goût d'agrumes et un peu de miel
Lovely nose. A light vanilla bourbon with peat! The taste is light and superb. Peat , caramel, mango with a sweet peaty aromas and tropical fruit! This bowmore is a nice surprise!

Jemné kouřivé a alkoholové aroma (i přes to,že má 40%vol).
Chuť kouřová a lehce kořeněná a slaná.
Celkově neurazí, ale nenadchne.

There's nothing legendary here, and perhaps a more apropos name would have been Bowmore Forget. In fact I'm still not sure what the hell I just tasted, though in complete candor the closest description I can use is: cardboard with the faintest hints of smoke and citrus. This is definitely Bowmore's weakest offering and best skipped over. Cheers!
Heavy peat even on the nose. Iodine and salt as expected from an islay whiskey. Beautiful smoke and coal flavour through all the tastings.
Better than expected given the ratings. Medium peat, but light floral and even vanilla. Has a little spice and pepper. I liked it and good price

Tourbe légère, jambon fumé, iodé, saveurs marines. Légère vanille au nez
Finale : caoutchouc

Manque un peu de personnalité

nose-salty , mild peat , sweet green apples , citrus
palate- vanilla , creamy lemon , little peat ,medium body 
finish- medium to short .little oak spice 
it's not very complex but enjoyable . i have had my bottle for more than 2 years and not even half way through . i would pay a bit more and buy the 12yr ahead of this .

fairly easy on the nose for an islay. there is the peat, and the sea air, but also Lemon and Orange. 
On the taste there is a pleasant amount of peat, fresh citrus, and after that, a sweetness like a sweet white wine. 
Adding a few drops of water seems to dull the peat a bit, and accenting the sweetness and lemon.
the finish is not long and a bit disappointing. Overall price/money a very nice Islay.
Peaty, short body. Good everyday dram.
